actions-list.actionItem: The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 7377.
Considered under suspension of the rules.

Mr. Westerman moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended. H.R. 7377 — "To amend the Federal Oil and Gas Royalty Management Act of 1982 to improve the management of royalties from oil and gas leases, and for other purposes."
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill Agreed to by voice vote.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on S. 3285.
Considered under suspension of the rules.

Mr. Bost moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill. S. 3285 — "To rename the community-based outpatient clinic of the Department of Veterans Affairs in Butte, Montana, as the "Charlie Dowd VA Clinic"."
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill Agreed to by voice vote.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 7333.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
Mr. Bost moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill. H.R. 7333 — "To name the Department of Veterans Affairs medical center in West Palm Beach, Florida, as the "Thomas H. Corey VA Medical Center"."

At the conclusion of debate, the Yeas and Nays were demanded and ordered. Pursuant to the provisions of clause 8, rule XX, the Chair announced that further proceedings on the motion would be postponed.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on S. 3249.
Considered under suspension of the rules.

Mr. Bost moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill. S. 3249 — "To designate the outpatient clinic of the Department of Veterans Affairs in Wyandotte County, Kansas City, Kansas, as the "Captain Elwin Shopteese VA Clinic"."
The Speaker announced that votes on suspensions, if ordered, will be postponed until a time to be announced.
The House convened, returning from a recess continuing the legislative day of July 22.
The Speaker announced that the House do now recess. The next meeting is subject to the call of the Chair.
The House proceeded with one minute speeches.

Mr. Carl asked unanimous consent That, it may be in order at any time on Wednesday, July 24, 2024, for the Speaker to declare a recess, subject to the call of the Chair, for the purpose of receiving in Joint Meeting His Excellency Benjamin Netanyahu, Prime Minister of Israel. Agreed to without objection.

actions-list.header: ADJUSTMENT OF THE WHOLE NUMBER OF THE HOUSE
actions-list.actionItem: Under Clause 5(d) of Rule XX, the Chair announced to the House that, in light of the passing of the gentlewoman from Texas, Ms. Jackson Lee, the whole number of the House is 432.
The Chair designated Mr. Carl to lead the Members in reciting the Pledge of Allegiance to the Flag.
The Speaker announced approval of the Journal.  Pursuant to clause 1, rule I, the Journal stands approved.
Today's prayer was offered by the House Chaplain, Chaplain Margaret Grun Kibben.
The House convened, returning from a recess continuing the legislative day of July 22.
The Speaker announced that the House do now recess. The next meeting is scheduled for 2:00 P.M. today.
The House proceeded with Morning-Hour Debate. At the conclusion of Morning-Hour, the House will recess until 2:00 p.m. for the start of legislative business.
The Speaker designated the Honorable Jerry L. Carl to act as Speaker pro tempore for today.
The House convened, starting a new legislative day.
